results.definition: be a signal for or a symptom of
examples: The economic indicators signal that the euro is undervalued

results.definition: any nonverbal action or gesture that encodes a message
examples: signals from the boat suddenly stopped

results.definition: communicate silently and non-verbally by signals or signs
examples: The diner signaled the waiters to bring the menu

results.definition: an electric quantity (voltage or current or field strength) whose modulation represents coded information about the source from which it comes

examples: he awaited the signal to start
the victory was a signal for wild celebration
the year saw one signal triumph for the Labour party
